intro: Struthanthus pentamerus, commonly known as the five-petaled struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. The plant's structure includes a short stem, palmate leaves, and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds.
